Question.Text: A 14-year-old boy presents to a clinic in Rural Tanzania with acute-onset non-progressive spastic paraplegia. There is no history of back pain. The main staple food crop in his village is cassava.

Answer: Konzo (spastic paraparesis from cassava toxicity) - The patient presents with acute-onset non-progressive spastic paraplegia without back pain in a cassava-dependent community in Tanzania. The images show cassava plants and affected individuals with spastic gait. Konzo results from chronic cyanide toxicity from insufficiently processed bitter cassava consumption, causing permanent but non-progressive bilateral leg weakness.
